translations.author: Saheeh International
translations.text: In the name of Allah, the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.

translations.author: Muhammad Hamidullah
translations.text: Au nom d'Allah, le Tout Miséricordieux, le Très Miséricordieux.

tafsirs.author: Ibn Kathir
tafsirs.text: In the Name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. These are the first words of the Quran and they are said before every action to seek blessings from Allah.

translations.author: Saheeh International
translations.text: [All] praise is [due] to Allah, Lord of the worlds.

translations.author: Muhammad Hamidullah
translations.text: Louange à Allah, Seigneur de l'univers.

tafsirs.author: Ibn Kathir
tafsirs.text: All praise and thanks are due to Allah, the Lord of all that exists.

translations.author: Saheeh International
translations.text: The Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.

translations.author: Muhammad Hamidullah
translations.text: Le Tout Miséricordieux, le Très Miséricordieux.

tafsirs.author: Ibn Kathir
tafsirs.text: He is the source of all mercy, both in this life and the hereafter.

translations.author: Saheeh International
translations.text: Sovereign of the Day of Recompense.

translations.author: Muhammad Hamidullah
translations.text: Maître du Jour de la rétribution.

tafsirs.author: Ibn Kathir
tafsirs.text: He is the sole owner and judge on the Day of Judgment.

translations.author: Saheeh International
translations.text: It is You we worship and You we ask for help.

translations.author: Muhammad Hamidullah
translations.text: C'est Toi [Seul] que nous adorons, et c'est Toi [Seul] dont nous implorons secours.

tafsirs.author: Ibn Kathir
tafsirs.text: This verse establishes the core of worship: submission to Allah alone and seeking help only from Him.
